GOP Ex-Sen. Inhofe Retired Due To Long COVID After Opposing COVID AidSara Boboltz2/24/2023

The longtime senator from Oklahoma said complications from the virus contributed to his stepping aside.

covid-19, long-covid, jim-inhofe, type: news, COVID-19, long covid, Jim Inhofe, PoliticsRead

    brandPlatform.push(zoneOne);

    brandPlatform.push('desktop');

    category = 'politics';
    
    

    
    renderer = 'cambria';

      locale: 'en',

      section: category,
      site: "us",
      subSections: [],
      tags: ["covid-19","jim-inhofe","long-covid"],
      testAds: testAds
    });

    function targetMap() {
      function csvToArr(str) {
        var str2 = str.replace(/(^\s+|\s+$)/g, '');
        return (str2.length && str2.split(",") || []);
      }
      var r = [];
      function addKV(key, val) {
        if (val.length > 0) {
          r.push([key, val]);
        }
      }
      addKV("destination", "huffpost");
      addKV("edition", "us");
      addKV("hpid", "63f8e9b7e4b0735bf8777e81");
      
      
      
      addKV("zone3", 'politics');
      
      
      addKV("pageType", csvToArr("bpage"));
      addKV("section", csvToArr(""));
      
      addKV("cms_tag", csvToArr("covid-19,jim-inhofe,long-covid"));
      
      addKV("user", csvToArr("sara-boboltz"));
      var dfpKeywordVal = HPGam.getQuery("dfp-keyword");
      if (dfpKeywordVal) {
        addKV('dfp-keyword', dfpKeywordVal);
      }
      if (renderer) {
        addKV('renderer', renderer);
      }
      
      return r;
    }

    googletag.cmd.push(function(){

      HPGam.log('setTargeting', map);

      });
    });

    return;
  });
</script>

<script>
window.waitForGlobal = function(identifier, cb, poll) {
  var test = typeof identifier === "function" ? identifier : function() { return !!window[identifier]; };
  var interval;
  if(test()) {
    cb();
  } else {
    interval = setInterval(function(){
      if(test()) {
        cb();
        clearInterval(interval);
      }
    }, poll || 50);
  }
};

window.modulousQueue = (function() {
  var queue = [];
  var run = false;
  function runner(fn) {
    setTimeout(function(){
      try {
        fn();
      } catch (e) {
      }
    }, 0);
  }
  return {
     add: function(fn) {
       var _tmp1 = !run && queue.push(fn);
       var _tmp2 = run && runner(fn);
     },
     runAll: function() {
       var i = 0;
       run = true;
       for(;i<queue.length;i++) {
         runner(queue[i]);
       }
       queue = [];
     }
  };
}());

setTimeout(function(){
  waitForGlobal('jQuery', modulousQueue.runAll);
}, 5000);

    </script></div></div></div><div class="primary-cli cli cli-text "><p>Former <a href="https://www.huffpost.com/topic/jim-inhofe" target="_blank" role="link" class=" js-entry-link cet-internal-link" data-vars-item-name="Sen. Jim Inhofe" data-vars-item-type="text" data-vars-unit-name="63f8e9b7e4b0735bf8777e81" data-vars-unit-type="buzz_body" data-vars-target-content-id="/topic/jim-inhofe" data-vars-target-content-type="feed" data-vars-type="web_internal_link" data-vars-subunit-name="article_body" data-vars-subunit-type="component" data-vars-position-in-subunit="0">Sen. Jim Inhofe</a> (R-Okla.) attributed his decision to retire due to the long-term effects of COVID-19, <a href="https://tulsaworld.com/news/state-and-regional/govt-and-politics/jim-inhofe-looks-back-on-his-career-i-really-wanted-to-make-a-difference-and/article_3e824aaa-9750-11ed-9be6-2fe21d735cfe.html" target="_blank" role="link" class=" js-entry-link cet-external-link" data-vars-item-name="telling local newspaper Tulsa World" data-vars-item-type="text" data-vars-unit-name="63f8e9b7e4b0735bf8777e81" data-vars-unit-type="buzz_body" data-vars-target-content-id="https://tulsaworld.com/news/state-and-regional/govt-and-politics/jim-inhofe-looks-back-on-his-career-i-really-wanted-to-make-a-difference-and/article_3e824aaa-9750-11ed-9be6-2fe21d735cfe.html" data-vars-target-content-type="url" data-vars-type="web_external_link" data-vars-subunit-name="article_body" data-vars-subunit-type="component" data-vars-position-in-subunit="1">telling local newspaper Tulsa World</a> that certain symptoms were still affecting him day-to-day. </p></div><div class="primary-cli cli cli-text "><p>Inhofe voted against multiple coronavirus aid packages meant to help Americans at the height of the pandemic, including the Families First Coronavirus Response Act approved overwhelmingly by 90 senators in March 2020, and the American Rescue Plan in March 2021.</p></div><div class="cli cli-advertisement advertisement-holder"><div class="advertisement-sticky-wrapper"><div class="advertisement__label">Advertisement</div><div class="advertisement"><div id="ad-inline-1" class="ad-entry_paragraph_1 ad-spot--gam ad-spot--gam-inline-1"></div>
<script type="text/javascript">
  HPGam.cmd.push(function(){
		return HPGam.render("inline-1", "entry_paragraph_1", false, false);
  });
</script>
</div></div></div><div class="primary-cli cli cli-text "><p>The 88-year-old did not say which symptoms he was dealing with. But he suggested he was in good company, alleging that other elected representatives in Congress are also struggling with long COVID behind the scenes.</p></div><div class="primary-cli cli cli-text "><p>“Five or six others have (long COVID), but I’m the only one who admits it,” Inhofe told Tulsa World. </p></div><div class="primary-cli cli cli-text "><p>At least one Democratic senator, Tim Kaine of Virginia, has <a href="https://www.kaine.senate.gov/press-releases/kaine-statement-on-new-long-covid-reports-from-the-department-of-health-and-human-services" role="link" class=" js-entry-link cet-external-link" data-vars-item-name="spoken openly" data-vars-item-type="text" data-vars-unit-name="63f8e9b7e4b0735bf8777e81" data-vars-unit-type="buzz_body" data-vars-target-content-id="https://www.kaine.senate.gov/press-releases/kaine-statement-on-new-long-covid-reports-from-the-department-of-health-and-human-services" data-vars-target-content-type="url" data-vars-type="web_external_link" data-vars-subunit-name="article_body" data-vars-subunit-type="component" data-vars-position-in-subunit="2">spoken openly</a> about his experience with lingering symptoms after contracting COVID-19. </p></div><figure class="cli cli-image js-no-inject"><div class="img-sized"><div class="img-sized__placeholder" style="width:720px"><div style="padding-top:66.52777777777777%"></div></div><picture><source type="image/webp" srcSet="https://img.huffingtonpost.com/asset/63f8f92a2500006f00e71265.jpeg?cache=ifYtzbYILb&ops=scalefit_720_noupscale&format=webp"/><img class="img-sized__img landscape" loading="lazy" fetchpriority="auto" alt="Sen. James Inhofe is seen in 2020." width="720" height="479" src="https://img.huffingtonpost.com/asset/63f8f92a2500006f00e71265.jpeg?cache=ifYtzbYILb&ops=scalefit_720_noupscale"/></picture></div><div class="cli-image__spacer"></div><div class="cli-image__source-wrapper"><figcaption class="cli-image__caption caption-cli">Sen. James Inhofe is seen in 2020.</figcaption><div class="cli-image__credit" aria-label="Image Credit: via Associated Press"><div class="credit-container"><span class="credit">via Associated Press</span></div></div></div></figure><div class="cli cli-advertisement advertisement-holder"><div class="advertisement-sticky-wrapper"><div class="advertisement__label">Advertisement</div><div class="advertisement"><div id="ad-inline-2" class="ad-entry_paragraph_3 ad-spot--gam ad-spot--gam-inline-2"></div>
<script type="text/javascript">
  HPGam.cmd.push(function(){
		return HPGam.render("inline-2", "entry_paragraph_3", false, false);
  });
</script>
</div></div></div><div class="primary-cli cli cli-text "><p>Inhofe’s chief of staff, Luke Holland, announced the senator had “a very mild case” of the virus <a href="https://okcfox.com/news/local/luke-holland-campaign-jim-inhofe-senate-oklahoma-resign-retire-chief-of-staff" role="link" class=" js-entry-link cet-external-link" data-vars-item-name="almost exactly one year ago" data-vars-item-type="text" data-vars-unit-name="63f8e9b7e4b0735bf8777e81" data-vars-unit-type="buzz_body" data-vars-target-content-id="https://okcfox.com/news/local/luke-holland-campaign-jim-inhofe-senate-oklahoma-resign-retire-chief-of-staff" data-vars-target-content-type="url" data-vars-type="web_external_link" data-vars-subunit-name="article_body" data-vars-subunit-type="component" data-vars-position-in-subunit="3">almost exactly one year ago</a>, the same day Inhofe announced he would be retiring.</p></div><div class="primary-cli cli cli-text "><p>His seat was filled in a special election by Markwayne Mullin, a Republican who had been representing Oklahomans in the House. </p></div><div class="primary-cli cli cli-text "><p>Inhofe was well-known for labeling climate change as a “hoax.” But as COVID-19 began rapidly spreading around the U.S., he urged caution even as he made light of precautionary measures.</p></div><div class="primary-cli cli cli-text "><p>“You know I’d be the first to say we’re overreacting because that’s kind of how I am, but we’re not,” Inhofe <a href="https://12ft.io/proxy?&q=https%3A%2F%2Ftulsaworld.com%2Fnews%2Fsen-jim-inhofe-on-covid-19-id-be-the-first-to-say-were-overreacting-but%2Farticle_6ad46d1a-6de7-554b-8676-9b980b8c4815.html" target="_blank" role="link" class=" js-entry-link cet-external-link" data-vars-item-name="told Tulsa World" data-vars-item-type="text" data-vars-unit-name="63f8e9b7e4b0735bf8777e81" data-vars-unit-type="buzz_body" data-vars-target-content-id="https://12ft.io/proxy?&q=https%3A%2F%2Ftulsaworld.com%2Fnews%2Fsen-jim-inhofe-on-covid-19-id-be-the-first-to-say-were-overreacting-but%2Farticle_6ad46d1a-6de7-554b-8676-9b980b8c4815.html" data-vars-target-content-type="url" data-vars-type="web_external_link" data-vars-subunit-name="article_body" data-vars-subunit-type="component" data-vars-position-in-subunit="4">told Tulsa World</a> in a March 2020 interview where he recalled trying to scare a New York Times reporter with a handshake. </p></div><aside class="cli cli-related-articles js-cet-subunit"><div readabilityObject.title: GOP Ex-Sen. Inhofe Retired Due To Long COVID After Opposing COVID Aid
readabilityObject.content:
Former Sen. Jim Inhofe (R-Okla.) attributed his decision to retire due to the long-term effects of COVID-19, telling local newspaper Tulsa World that certain symptoms were still affecting him day-to-day.

Inhofe voted against multiple coronavirus aid packages meant to help Americans at the height of the pandemic, including the Families First Coronavirus Response Act approved overwhelmingly by 90 senators in March 2020, and the American Rescue Plan in March 2021.

The 88-year-old did not say which symptoms he was dealing with. But he suggested he was in good company, alleging that other elected representatives in Congress are also struggling with long COVID behind the scenes.

“Five or six others have (long COVID), but I’m the only one who admits it,” Inhofe told Tulsa World.

At least one Democratic senator, Tim Kaine of Virginia, has spoken openly about his experience with lingering symptoms after contracting COVID-19.

Inhofe’s chief of staff, Luke Holland, announced the senator had “a very mild case” of the virus almost exactly one year ago, the same day Inhofe announced he would be retiring.

His seat was filled in a special election by Markwayne Mullin, a Republican who had been representing Oklahomans in the House.

Inhofe was well-known for labeling climate change as a “hoax.” But as COVID-19 began rapidly spreading around the U.S., he urged caution even as he made light of precautionary measures.

“You know I’d be the first to say we’re overreacting because that’s kind of how I am, but we’re not,” Inhofe told Tulsa World in a March 2020 interview where he recalled trying to scare a New York Times reporter with a handshake.

Popular in the Community
